TypeofYou can use this to get native Lua types corresponding to appropriate C++ type.
Functions
get_valueGets a value of type specified by template parameter T from the stack held by state L on index idx.
pop_valueGets a value from the stack using get_value and pops it out.
get_stackGets contents of the whole stack and returns them in a Vector.
pop_stackCalls get_stack, pops out required amount of items from the stack and returns the vector.
lua_native_wrapServes as a wrapper for C++ functions callable from Lua.

push_value

template<typename T, typename U> inline void push_value(
   lua_State *L,
   const types::Map<T, U> &v
)

Support for the Map container is enabled conditionally.  If the header is included, map is supported (note that you have to include it BEFORE lua.h).

push_value

template<typename T, typename U> inline void push_value(
   lua_State *L,
   const types::Hash_Map<T, U> &v
)

Support for the Hash_Map container is enabled conditionally.  If the header is included, hashmap is supported (note that you have to include it BEFORE lua.h).

const types::Tuple<T...> &t)

Variables

Typeof

template<typename T> struct Typeof { enum { value = LUA_TNONE }; }

You can use this to get native Lua types corresponding to appropriate C++ type.  Defined for:

boolLUA_TBOOLEAN
NilLUA_TNIL
ObjectLUA_TUSERDATA
DynamicLUA_TUSERDATA
FunctionLUA_TFUNCTION
TableLUA_TTABLE
StringLUA_TSTRING
charLUA_TSTRING
const char*LUA_TSTRING
char*LUA_TSTRING
ucharLUA_TSTRING
const uchar*LUA_TSTRING
uchar*LUA_TSTRING
shortLUA_TNUMBER
intLUA_TNUMBER
longLUA_TNUMBER
llongLUA_TNUMBER
ushortLUA_TNUMBER
uintLUA_TNUMBER
ulongLUA_TNUMBER
ullongLUA_TNUMBER
floatLUA_TNUMBER
doubleLUA_TNUMBER
long doubleLUA_TNUMBER
lua_CFunctionLUA_TFUNCTION
T*LUA_TUSERDATA

Usage

// will be LUA_TNUMBER
int type = stack::Typeof<5>::value;

Functions

get_value

template<typename T> inline T get_value(lua_State *L,
int idx)

Gets a value of type specified by template parameter T from the stack held by state L on index idx.

Has specializations for various types.  T can be either generic object that can be constructed from L and idx or one of these:

Tgeneric object with (L, idx) constructor
ObjectObject
DynamicDynamic
FunctionFunction
TableTable
Nillua.Nil
Booleanbool
Stringconst char*, const uchar*, char*, uchar*
StringString_Base.String
Characterchar, uchar
Integral numbershort, int, long, llong, ushort, uint, ulong, ullong
Floating point numberfloat
Floating point numberdouble, long double
C functionlua_CFunction
Raw statelua_State*.

pop_value

template<typename T> inline T pop_value(lua_State *L)

Gets a value from the stack using get_value and pops it out.

get_stack

template<typename T> inline types::Vector<T> get_stack(lua_State *L,
int n)

Gets contents of the whole stack and returns them in a Vector.  The type held by the vector is specified by the template parameter.  You can specify additional argument n specifying how many items to get from the stack; by default it’s -1 and that means it gets all the items.

pop_stack

template<typename T> inline types::Vector<T> pop_stack(lua_State *L,
int n)

Calls get_stack, pops out required amount of items from the stack and returns the vector.

lua_native_wrap

template<typename T, typename... U> inline int lua_native_wrap(lua_State *L)

Serves as a wrapper for C++ functions callable from Lua.  Expands arguments properly through a tuple.

template<typename T, typename U> struct Map: Set<Pair<T, U> >
See Set.
template<typename T, typename U> struct Hash_Map: Hash_Set<Pair<T, U> >
See Hash_Set.
template<typename T> struct Typeof { enum { value = LUA_TNONE }; }
You can use this to get native Lua types corresponding to appropriate C++ type.
template<typename T> inline T get_value(lua_State *L,
int idx)
Gets a value of type specified by template parameter T from the stack held by state L on index idx.
template<typename T> inline T pop_value(lua_State *L)
Gets a value from the stack using get_value and pops it out.
template<typename T> inline types::Vector<T> get_stack(lua_State *L,
int n)
Gets contents of the whole stack and returns them in a Vector.
template<typename T> struct Vector
Vector is a container that holds a list of elements simillarily to an array, but it’s generic, can be easily manipulated (resized, appended etc.)
template<typename T> inline types::Vector<T> pop_stack(lua_State *L,
int n)
Calls get_stack, pops out required amount of items from the stack and returns the vector.
template<typename T, typename... U> inline int lua_native_wrap(lua_State *L)
Serves as a wrapper for C++ functions callable from Lua.
struct Object
This is an object, a container holding a reference to any Lua type.
struct Dynamic: Function
This is a “Dynamic”, a generic object that can behave as a value, a bit like table, function, etc.
struct Function: Object
struct Table: Object
This structure represents the Lua table.
struct Nil {}
An empty structure you don’t usually make instances of, the only (singleton) instance is nil.
Defined as String_Base<char>.
